clusters.title: Gymnastics coach accused of sexually touching child
clusters.neutral_headline: Gymnastics Coach Accused of Sexually Touching Child

items.title: Gymnastics coach accused of sexually touching child
items.standfirst: A Gold Coast gymnastics studio has been closed after a coach was extradited to NSW to face a charge stemming from a Sydney hotel stay.
items.content: A gymnastics coach will face court tomorrow after being accused of sexually touching a child.Coach Wei Jun Lee runs a Gold Coast gymnastics studio that has now been closed as he faces the serious criminal charge in Sydney.The 32-year-old was extradited on the charge of sexually touching a child between the age of 10 and 16 at a Rooty Hill hotel in April.READ MORE: Three people found unresponsive, two with stab wounds, in Blue Mountains home The alleged crime took place two days before Sydney hosted a state championships in gymnastics.Lee faced a magistrate on Friday and was refused bail.He will be up again at Blacktown Local Court tomorrow.Gymnastics Australia said Skybound Gymnastics Club in Burleigh Heads had been closed."Gymnastics Australia and Gymnastics Queensland are aware of an active police investigation involving a coach who is also a club owner, and who has been arrested," Gymnastics Australia said, in a statement."This matter is being managed by the police and we will not be providing further comment on the investigation."

items.standfirst: A gymnastics coach will face court tomorrow after being accused of sexually touching a child.
items.content: A gymnastics coach will face court tomorrow after being accused of sexually touching a child.

ai_summary: A gymnastics coach faces charges.
The coach is accused of sexually touching a child.
A Gold Coast studio was closed.
The coach was extradited to NSW.
The coach will face court.

clusters.title: Huge pro-Palestine crowd marches in Melbourne as part of national rally
clusters.neutral_headline: Pro-Palestine Protests Held Across Australia

items.title: Huge pro-Palestine crowd marches in Melbourne as part of national rally
items.standfirst: Victorian activists joined a nationwide pro-Palestine demonstration that kicked off in cities across Australia on Sunday, amid rising starvation in Gaza.
items.content: Victorian activists joined a nationwide pro-Palestine demonstration that kicked off in cities across Australia on Sunday, amid rising starvation in Gaza.

items.title: Pro-Palestine protests across Australia attract staggering turnout
items.standfirst: A huge number of pro-Palestine protesters have marched across multiple cities in Australia in one of the movement's biggest rally days to date.
items.content: Huge numbers of pro-Palestine protesters have marched across multiple cities in Australia in one of the movement's biggest rally days to date.Organisers say as many as 290,000 gathered in total, including 100,000 in both Sydney and Melbourne .Organisers said up to 50,000 gathered in Brisbane's CBD following a last-minute route change.READ MORE: 'Heartbreaking': The hidden toll of Sydney's wettest August in 27 yearsOrganisers initially claimed 7000 people would take part in the protest, which began in Queens Park, continued across the Victoria Bridge and ended in Musgrave Park.Queensland senator and Greens leader Larissa Waters was part of the march and made a speech to those gathered."The voice of Australia is really clear, we want peace, we want sanctions on the Israeli government, we want aid to get through," she said.Protesters initially attempted to close down Brisbane's Story Bridge for today's rally , however Queensland's chief magistrate ruled the protest posed a significant risk to public safety.Organisers then vowed to take a different route after the court blocked the Story Bridge plan.Today's group was knocked back from being allowed to protest on the Story Bridge earlier this week.Police took court action to block the demonstration.READ MORE: Your phone might have cancer – but it's not what you think READ MORE: Five killed, dozens injured after bus crashes en route from Niagara Falls They cited concerns about being able to provide enough staff to police the route at short notice, disruption to emergency service routes and access to major hospitals, and increased traffic due to the Brisbane Lions AFL match.Up to 10,000 people were initially expected to join.The protest was mostly peaceful with no major incidents, though one arrest was made after a man with an Australian flag threw insults at marchers. READ MORE: Three people found unresponsive, two with stab wounds, in Blue Mountains homeMelbourne rally attracts up to 100,000 Meanwhile, thousands of people in Melbourne also marched in solidarity with Palestine.Organisers claimed up to 100,000 people took part in the march, which began today outside the State Library in Melbourne's CBD. Today's rally in Melbourne was the 97th consecutive pro-Palestine rally in the city.A small police presence stood on the corner of Swanston and Lonsdale streets, tasked with preparing for the march through the CBD of Melbourne, but there were no reports of major incidents from the march.READ MORE: Woman's body found on St Kilda beach Sydney marches againSydneysiders also held a march today, beginning at the Archibald Fountain in Hyde Park.High-profile protesters included Grace Tame, who addressed the crowd and journalist Antoinette Lattouf.READ MORE: Chinese bridge collapse kills at least 12 construction workersProtesters in Sydney shut down the famous Harbour Bridge on August 3 after a successful fight against the state government to access the route.Around 100,000 people joined the pro-Palestine march, which marked the first time protesters had walked across the bridge. Protesters flood other major cities around the nationPro-Palestine protesters also to the streets of Perth in their thousands.An estimated 20,000 people gathered in Forrest Place in the CBD for a march organised by Friends of Palestine WA.There was also a gathering in the nation's capital, where about 2000 protesters gathered, including Independent Senator David Pocock.READ MORE: Body of woman, 32, found washed up on beach on NSW North CoastAbout 15,000 people gathered in Adelaide, marching from Victoria Square and through the middle of the city.Independent Senator Fatima Payman, who left the Labor Party over its position on the Gaza conflict, spoke to protestors in the city. Hobart also saw a crowd of 5000 gather and march through the city.Protesters stretched for multiple blocks as the march made its way through the CBD to Franklin Square.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: Pro-Palestine protests occurred across Australia.
Huge crowds marched in multiple cities.
The protests were part of a national rally.
The protests occurred amid rising starvation in Gaza.
Victorian activists joined the demonstrations.

clusters.title: Unconscious woman and two men with stab wounds found in Blue Mountains
clusters.neutral_headline: Three People Found Unresponsive in Blue Mountains
bullet_summary: Two men with multiple stab wounds, and a woman found unconscious, were located after police respond to a welfare concern this morning

items.title: Unconscious woman and two men with stab wounds found in Blue Mountains
items.standfirst: A woman is fighting for life and two men have series stab wounds
items.content: A tight-knit community in the Blue Mountains is at the centre of a possible domestic violence investigation, after two men were found stabbed and a woman unconscious.Police were called to a home in Leura, about 80 kilometres west of Sydney, this morning after officers received a request to check on the welfare of the residents.Inside the Myall Avenue house, a woman in her 60s was found unconscious.READ MORE: Abandoned train station in Sydney's east to be revivedShe was taken away on a stretcher to Blue Mountains District Hospital in a critical condition.Two men believed to be in their 40s, one of whom is believed to be the son of the woman, were also found.The pair both had multiple stab wounds, with one man seen with a wound to his neck. They were treated by paramedics on the scene and taken to Westmead Hospital in a serious but stable condition.Police say a crime scene has been established, with the area surrounding the house in lockdown.No charges have been laid, but investigations are still ongoing. Support is available from the National Sexual Assault, Domestic and Family Violence Counselling Service at 1800RESPECT (1800 737 732).DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.content: Two men with multiple stab wounds, and a woman found unconscious, were located after police respond to a welfare concern this morning.

clusters.title: Man charged with former partner Carra Luke's murder
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Charged with Murder of Former Partner
bullet_summary: Ms Luke, 48, was found with fatal stab wounds at her home in Taigum early Saturday morning
Carra Luke, 48, was found unconscious in her Taigum bedroom by family members this morning, just after midnight

items.title: Man charged with former partner Carra Luke's murder
items.standfirst: Ms Luke, 48, was found with fatal stab wounds at her home in Taigum early Saturday morning.
items.content: Ms Luke, 48, was found with fatal stab wounds at her home in Taigum early Saturday morning.

items.title: Man, 52, charged with murder after mother found dead in Brisbane home
items.standfirst: Carra Luke, 48, was found unconscious in her Taigum bedroom by family members this morning, just after midnight.
items.content: A man has been charged with murder after a mother-of-two was found dead in her home in Brisbane's north. Carra Luke, 48, was found unconscious in her bedroom on Osprey Place in Taigum by family members yesterday morning, just after midnight.She had suffered "significant" stab wounds and was declared dead at the scene.READ MORE: Thousands to flood Brisbane's CBD for pro-Palestine rally Police have charged a 52-year-old man known to the woman with one count of murder and one count of entering a dwelling with intent.He will appear before Brisbane Magistrates Court tomorrow."Investigators would like to thank members of the public for providing information that greatly supported the investigation," Queensland Police said in a statement.Multiple crime scenes were set up across Brisbane after Luke was found dead.Following investigations, police visited a home on Hackman Street in McDowall at 1.10am and arrested the charged man."The linkage between the two addresses and the parties involved is part of the investigation process," Acting Assistant Commissioner Rhys Wildman said.Forensic officers spent the day scouring the McDowall home for evidence.9News understands the man had been living there with his parents and is known to Luke."We're investigating all angles, including domestic violence," Wildman said.READ MORE: Alleged arsonist targets popular Queen Victoria Market in Melbourne The SES was called in to help search a nearby aged care facility late this afternoon, which has now been declared a third crime scene.The 52-year-old man remains in custody at the Pine Rivers Watchhouse.Luke has been described by those who knew her as a devoted mother, a respected nurse and a generous neighbour."Everyone on the street is devastated by the news morning," neighbour Jackson Hughesman said."Carra was a kind and loving person who would go to extremes for anyone she met."We will miss her chats, her generosity and kindness. The family is in our thoughts during this hard time."Her colleagues at the Nundah Doctor Surgery said "Carra has been with us for 20 years and was the heart and soul of the practice".Police urged the public, specifically Taigum residents on Handford Road, Beams Road, Roghan Road and Church Road, to check CCTV footage between 10pm yesterday and 1am today.National Sexual Assault, Domestic Family Violence Counselling Service 1800RESPECT (1800 737 732).

ai_summary: A man has been charged with the murder of Carra Luke.
Carra Luke was found dead in her Brisbane home.
She was discovered with fatal stab wounds.
Family members found her unconscious early Saturday morning.
The accused is a 52-year-old man.
